definition: abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Back in the dark ages some schoolteachers used to say this to the children in their care before administering corporal punishment.
sentences.chinese: 過去在黑暗時代，老師們在體罰孩子之前總是這樣說。

sentences.english: Why is the Middle Ages also called the Dark Ages?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼中古時代被稱爲黑暗時代？

sentences.english: What if our civilisation is followed by a second dark age?
sentences.chinese: 如果我們的文明又要迎來一個黑暗時代怎麼辦？

sentences.english: The answer, I think, is that we're living in a Dark Age of macroeconomics.
sentences.chinese: 我想，答案是我們正生活在一個宏觀經濟學黑暗時代。

sentences.english: They weren't big on happy endings in the Dark Ages.
sentences.chinese: 在黑暗時代，故事總沒有皆大歡喜的結局。

sentences.english: Ming Wanghou, China is in the dark ages, the nobody expressing an opinion, the people have no means to make a living.
sentences.chinese: 明亡後，中國處於黑暗時代，萬馬齊喑，民不聊生。

sentences.english: Wycliffe came from the obscurity of the Dark Ages.
sentences.chinese: 威克里夫出身於中古黑暗時代之中。
